data.quote: I think people should be protected from being made to feel that they want to know what somebody famous had for breakfast.

data.quote: Famous doesn't mean anything. Just because people know my face doesn't mean they know us or that it makes us any more interesting or better.

data.quote: The worst thing about being famous is the invasion of your privacy.

data.quote: Sometimes I get a little exhausted by shows or movies that are constantly throwing famous people on. And I find it so much more exciting to not have that when I'm watching something. data.quote: I think basically becoming famous has taken the place of going to Heaven in modern society, hasn't it? That's the place where your dreams will come true. It's an act of faith now; they think that's going to sort things out.

data.quote: I know I'm not supposed to have any opinions about politics, because I'm famous.

data.quote: I've been famous my entire life I don't know any other way.

data.quote: When you look at Michael Jackson, there's nobody who loves him in that family, nobody. If they did, they'd tell him he didn't have to do all that in order to be famous. data.quote: I took classical piano for a couple of years, but I sort of lost interest - I couldn't read a note today if I tried. data.quote: Famous pivot stories are often failures but you don't need to fail before you pivot. All a pivot is is a change is strategy without a change in vision. data.author: Robert Caro

data.quote: My discrepancy with children in the industry is that they are made famous before they know who they are as human beings.

data.quote: The Obama administration has turned a blind eye to radical Islam since before they came to office. That is not a good sign for America's foreign policy.

data.quote: The only reason I became the singer in the band is because I sang the best. It wasn't out of some desire to be a star or be a famous singer. It's not like I love interviews.

data.quote: When I started out as a model, I took things for granted. Because I bagged work thanks to my looks, I didn't give my body any importance. I was a couch potato who'd eat anything. data.author: Samantha Morton

data.quote: 'Blanche' opened a new door for me without really making me more famous. 'Blanche' was a risk, but that is the only thing that excites me in this profession. The knowledge that I am an actress who takes risks lifts my soul.
data.author: Lou Doillon

data.quote: I'm in my father's car at age 9 or 10 crying to Leonard Cohen's 'Famous Blue Raincoat,' thinking that you could write nearly a love letter to a man who betrayed you by having an affair with your wife. I was thinking how wonderful and pure music can be for explaining situations.
data.author: Lou Doillon

data.quote: A lot of what gets on the radio isn't saying anything other than somebody wants to be famous and will do whatever they're told to get it.
data.author: Kacey Musgraves

data.quote: I think it would collapse my heart if I was super famous. I don't have the nerve for it, I'm too anxious. I don't know how you're not obsessed with how people perceive you, because they're real people, you know? You can convince yourself that they don't really know you, and that's true, but how can it not hurt your feelings?
data.author: Bo Burnham

data.quote: I was determined to make Renaissance Man Food Services and Herschel's Famous 34 major players in a very tough industry.
data.author: Herschel Walker

data.quote: I don't think I'll ever feel as famous or as popular as I felt when I was a 17-year-old soccer player in Modle. Only about 20,000 people live there and 12,000 of them come to every game. Running onto the pitch each week was just the most fantastic feeling. Nothing can beat that.
data.author: Jo Nesbo

data.quote: You've got certain guys that just want to be famous and then you've got the real musicians that just love playing music.
data.author: Zakk Wylde

data.quote: The poster boy for our superabled future is Oscar Pistorius, an increasingly famous South African sprinter who happens to have had both of his legs amputated below the knee. Using upside down question mark-shaped carbon fiber sprinting prosthetics, called Cheetah blades, Mr. Pistorius can challenge the fastest sprinters in the world.
data.author: Daniel H. Wilson

data.quote: I'm not thirsty. I'm not a pop star. I don't want to reign over all forever... I don't want to be famous! It makes me feel sick, the thought of being a famous person. It's just not me.
data.author: FKA twigs

data.quote: I like vampires, tuberculosis, anything to do with blood. Then I read a biography of Rasputin and found out he'd had this daughter who had become a famous lion tamer and been billed as the daughter of the mad monk who was able to hypnotize animals with her eyes. It gave me a vision.
data.author: Kathryn Harrison

data.quote: One of the hardest things for me, now that I'm famous, is finding people who can read my stuff and give me an honest critique.
data.author: Ken Follett

data.quote: Once you're famous you can't go back.
data.author: Matthew Morrison

data.quote: My mother was never very famous when I was growing up, so it wasn't so difficult. It was only when I left home and went to university that she become this style icon.
data.author: Julia Restoin Roitfeld

data.quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you.
data.author: Robert De Niro

data.quote: I'm the man that made wrestling famous.
data.author: Hulk Hogan

data.quote: Famous old houses seem to have an intuitive perception of the value of corner lots. If it is a possible thing, they always set themselves down on the most desirable spots.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
data.author: Bradley Cooper

data.quote: I was a shy kid, but somehow I knew I would make it as a performer. I'd always be telling my mum that I was going to be a famous singer. In my school yearbooks I would write, 'Remember me when I'm famous.' I knew I had a gift.

data.quote: The true fans were capable of not only painting their cars and homes their team colors, but also naming family pets and offspring after famous NFL all-stars.
data.author: Burgess Owens

data.quote: I've worked with a lot of people who are more famous than myself who are terribly insecure.
data.author: Barry Gibb

data.quote: My reaction when I hear the word 'celebrity' is, 'Who, me?' It doesn't feel like I'm famous.
data.author: Charlie Cox

data.quote: Being big and famous doesn't get you more freedom, it gets you less.
data.author: Robert Wyatt

data.quote: Normal is such a hard word to use, because everyone's idea of normal is different. Real is what the word is. I think you either live a real life or you live a weird celebrity pseudolife. I think I lead a really real life.
data.author: Sarah Michelle Gellar

data.quote: The more they applaud, the bigger your salary will be.
data.author: Anna Held

data.quote: I felt so painfully isolated that I vowed I would get revenge on the world by becoming a famous cartoonist.
data.author: Robert Crumb

data.quote: I drive around on my scooter in Milan alone - we don't have bodyguards or anything like that. I am a fashion designer, not a celebrity, and although I get stopped for autographs and the like, I don't think I am famous.
data.author: Stefano Gabbana

data.quote: I'm coming out with a wine... I'm actually a restaurateur. I have Famous Famiglia Pizzeria that has opened up in the Sacramento airport. I'm also working with my business partner on opening up the Linnethia Lounge.
data.author: NeNe Leakes

data.quote: You're not famous until my mother has heard of you.
data.author: Jay Leno

data.quote: I don't see myself as a famous person.
data.author: Jess Glynne

data.quote: None of my characters are rich or famous, and the situations they find themselves in could happen to anyone.
data.author: Nicholas Sparks

data.quote: Celebrity distorts democracy by giving the rich, beautiful, and famous more authority than they deserve.
data.author: Maureen Dowd

data.quote: Celebrity is the advantage of being known to people who we don't know, and who don't know us.
data.author: Nicolas Chamfort

data.quote: I don't see myself as famous I see myself as a normal person with a job that is not very normal. My work life is very out there and very public. But I do my best to maintain my privacy.
data.author: Hailey Baldwin

data.quote: You do stand-up because you have to do it. If you're doing it to become 'famous,' you're wrong. If you're doing it to become a millionaire, you're doing it for the wrong reasons. In 2003, I was flat broke. I'd been doing stand-up for 14 years at that point. I loved it and just kept at it.
data.author: Russell Peters

data.quote: I love going to the beach. I like just walking around South Beach, but sometimes, when you're famous, it can be a little difficult.
data.author: Nicky Jam

data.quote: I can do whatever I want - I'm rich, I'm famous, and I'm bigger than you.
data.author: Don Johnson

data.quote: Kids will keep it real. If I've ever had in my life a great anchor, it's them. They get in your head, 'don't get too famous.' If you think you're really famous and think you're really hip, go hang out with your kids for an afternoon. That's about as earthbound as it's going to get.
data.author: Lionel Richie

data.quote: I don't like being famous - it is like a prison. And driving for Ferrari would make it far worse.
data.author: Valentino Rossi

data.quote: I've always had a career. I have been working hard since I was 15 years old. Being someone's 'girlfriend' was never what I wanted to be famous for. What makes you 'famous' isn't always what you want to be 'labeled' as or known for.
data.author: Adrienne Bailon

data.quote: Our top story tonight: Famous TV dolphin flipper was arrested today on prostitution ring charges. He allegedly was seen transporting two 16 year olds across state line for immoral porpoises.
data.author: Colin Mochrie

data.quote: A woman who becomes famous through her work reduces her erotic value. A woman is permitted to chat or babble, but speaking in public with authority is still the greatest transgression.
data.author: Elfriede Jelinek

data.quote: I think that once you open the door and allow people in on a certain aspect, it's very hard to then control how far that ripple effect is. So I think that the person who is known or famous has the ability to decide what they do or don't want to share.
data.author: Rosie O'Donnell

data.quote: Musicals are famous for being in a constant state of flux.
data.author: Tim Curry

data.quote: That the work involved, the willingness to take chances, the commitment, the opportunity to get on stage and make people happy, was more important than becoming famous, or even what I was dancing.
data.author: Suzanne Farrell

data.quote: My name's Jennifer Ellison and one day I'm going to be famous!
data.author: Jennifer Ellison

data.quote: I have my own spiritual guru, and I'm so happy, and I feel so satisfied that I might appreciate many other famous gurus, but, you know, I am not attracted that way because I have found the person.
data.author: Ravi Shankar

data.quote: Famous people feel that they must perpetually be on the crest of the wave, not realising that it is against all the rules of life. You can't be on top all the time, it isn't natural.

data.quote: My story of success and failure is not just about music and being famous. It's about living and loving and trying to find purpose in this crazy world.
data.author: Wynonna Judd

data.quote: I put my money in the bank: I have to think of life after modeling, when I'm not famous any more.
data.author: Eva Herzigova

data.quote: Celebrity culture, it's everywhere, isn't it? It's reality TV, Big Brother. I didn't become a footballer to be famous, I became a footballer to be successful. I didn't want to be famous. Now people want to be famous. Why? Why would you want people following you about all day?
data.author: Ryan Giggs

data.quote: I don't know if this is the kind of retrospective analysis that people are fond of applying to their work or actions, but it feels like I knew I was going to be famous and I knew that an element of that would be traumatic, so that if I could make myself something big and otherworldly, it would be a kind of defence.
data.author: Russell Brand

data.quote: I don't really know a lot of famous people. I've met a lot of famous people. If I ran into Tom Hanks today, I would have to remind him who I was and he would then remember me. But he wouldn't come up to me and say, 'Hi Dave!'
data.author: David Zucker

data.quote: Being famous before you've formed your personality, before you have that self-esteem, is dangerous.
data.author: Chris Evert

data.quote: When you're a famous, successful person at 16 years old, the rules change for you. Everybody is doing things for you to make life easier so you can go out and play. And I think you miss out on lot of growing up and a lot of reality checks.

data.quote: I had a flight trainer who is one of the biggest and most famous helicopter pilots the world.
data.author: Izabella Scorupco

data.quote: I seek no longer to be a 'famous' person, and instead I wish to live a 'normal' life.
data.author: Sinead O'Connor

data.quote: When I'm living in the world of luxury and celebrity, which is where I found myself for a large part of my life, it's a walk-on part. Not a vital necessity, like it is for so many people. I enjoy it but I can see right through it!

data.quote: I don't know if any famous people follow me, but their daughters definitely do.
data.author: Lucky Blue Smith

data.quote: I'm not the guy that wants to be famous and make loads of money and sell loads of records. I don't want that. I just want to be true. I want to be... I want to serve music. I want to be honest.

data.quote: I never wanted to be rich or successful or famous. I just wanted to be happy and have fun.
data.author: Donna Leon

data.quote: I think success right now is not about how famous you are or how much you're getting paid, but it's more about if you're steadily working and you're happy with what you're doing.

data.quote: If you ever get rich and famous, by definition you are special. You have done something special, and therefore you start to behave special. Then if the floor drops out, and you become down and out, you have a really new perspective.

data.quote: The seven wise men of Greece, so famous for their wisdom all the world over, acquired all that fame, each of them, by a single sentence consisting of two or three words.
data.author: Robert South

data.quote: Living in L.A., everyone likes to mold you and change you. I don't care about fame, I don't care about being a celebrity. I know that's part of the job, but I don't feed into anyone's idea of who I should be.

data.quote: If there's anything more mortifying than being famous at 14, it's being washed up right after.
data.author: Moon Unit Zappa

data.quote: For famous men have the whole earth as their memorial.
data.author: Pericles

data.quote: Fame is a lot of pressure, especially when you're responsible for your entire family. Financially, emotionally - everything.

data.quote: I would be a huge hypocrite if I didn't tell you that at one time in my life I thought the way that you made music was you got on a major label and you got famous.

data.quote: Stardom can be a gilded slavery.

data.quote: I'm just not a private person. It's not like I do things because I want things to be public; it's just that's my way of expressing myself, and I happen to be very famous.

data.quote: Celebrity, to me, is not a thing to seek.
data.author: Aidan Quinn

data.quote: Celebrity gives us delusion of self importance.

data.quote: For somebody famous, it's weird anyway to meet someone, because they have a preconceived notion of who you are.

data.quote: I've been around some very famous people, but no one has the effect Maradona has; people tremble in his presence.
data.author: Emir Kusturica

data.quote: Why does anybody want to be famous? You know what's important to me? Having lunch! Pasta! Seeing my friends! Is that so crazy?

data.quote: Rich and famous is not bad, but poor and famous sucks.

data.quote: I've certainly not got any famous people's numbers on my phone. It's just not my thing, really.

data.quote: I can't see any value in being a celebrity, famous for being famous.

data.quote: I'm sure there will come a time when I won't be able to, you know, walk around so easy sometimes, or it's just things that I don't necessarily want. I don't really necessarily want to be famous.

data.quote: There's so many things I want to do. I want to work with great filmmakers, great actors, great scripts. And there's no reason for me to do anything short of that, because I'm 24, I don't have a family, I don't need to make tons of money, and I'm not dying to get famous.

data.quote: You can find love when you are famous if you are the same person you were before you were famous.

data.quote: I was very famous as a young man and I celebrated both the good and bad times with drinking.

data.quote: I'm so fascinated by YouTube culture. I have no idea how it's working, but more and more people are becoming Internet famous, and it is because it allows you to have an atmosphere in which you feel comfortable to be yourself, which you might not get otherwise.

data.quote: The image we have of a famous person often bears no relation to them.

data.quote: I pretended to be somebody I wanted to be until finally I became that person. Or he became me.
data.author: Cary Grant

data.quote: When you become famous, you start getting invites to parties where there are famous athletes and famous rock stars, politicians, people who have tremendous power and affluence. It's not in my DNA, but certainly I have been exposed to it.

data.quote: One of the differences between real documentaries and reality television, besides the artificial construct of reality television, is that the people who are recruited to be on those shows, and the people who are interested in going on those shows, basically want to be famous. data.quote: All I say is that I don't go out with famous men.

data.quote: The Bronx is famous for two things. Hip-hop, and 26 world championships.

It kept me working and kept me grounded.

data.quote: My goal was never to be famous, but to be a consistently working actor.

data.quote: I didn't want to be famous. I just wanted to earn enough money to have a nice life and enjoy acting.

data.quote: Fame, I have already. Now I need the money.

data.quote: I will either be famous or infamous.

data.quote: There is no celebrity quite as powerful as the local, homegrown celebrity.

data.quote: I wasn't a kid who moved out from Iowa with aspirations of becoming a famous star - I was intrigued by the idea of filmmaking and by the idea of what it would be like to play a character in a movie.

data.quote: In the U.S. there are many people willing to work on $9 per hour, which is causing Tasmania to lose its famous apple industry and Australia to import more and more of its fruit and food from lower cost countries. In fact, all over Australia there are warning signs of us killing or restricting our own industries.
data.author: Gina Rinehart

data.author: Jacqueline Leo

data.quote: Indeed, wretched the man whose fame makes his misfortunes famous.
data.author: Lucius Accius

data.quote: I wasn't like, 'I want to be famous.' I just wanted to be an actor. I wasn't chasing anything. I was never stressed or worried. I never had any fear of rejection or not making it, anything like that.

data.quote: Indy makes the race driver. You become famous when you come here.

data.quote: They eat the dainty food of famous chefs with the same pleasure with which they devour gross peasant dishes, mostly composed of garlic and tomatoes, or fisherman's octopus and shrimps, fried in heavily scented olive oil on a little deserted beach.
data.author: Luigi Barzini

data.quote: Slowly but surely, we are acquiring that famous culture of democracy, which is our objective.
data.author: Paul Biya

data.quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
data.author: Hans Christian Andersen

data.quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.
data.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

data.quote: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: We need to find God, and he cannot be found in noise and restlessness. God is the friend of silence. See how nature - trees, flowers, grass- grows in silence; see the stars, the moon and the sun, how they move in silence... We need silence to be able to touch souls.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: So many times, people told me I can't do this or can't do that. My nature is that I don't listen very well. I'm very determined, and I believe in myself. My parents brought me up that way. Thank God for that. I don't let anything stand in my way.
data.author: Chantal Sutherland

data.quote: Delicious autumn! My very soul is wedded to it, and if I were a bird I would fly about the earth seeking the successive autumns.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Nature is the art of God.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: Sunset is still my favorite color, and rainbow is second.
data.author: Mattie Stepanek

data.quote: Joy in looking and comprehending is nature's most beautiful gift.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Over every mountain there is a path, although it may not be seen from the valley.
data.author: Theodore Roethke

data.quote: Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
data.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

data.quote: The best thing one can do when it's raining is to let it rain.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Nature... is nothing but the inner voice of self-interest.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: The sky broke like an egg into full sunset and the water caught fire.
data.author: Pamela Hansford Johnson

data.quote: Deep in their roots, all flowers keep the light.
data.author: Theodore Roethke

data.quote: Earth and sky, woods and fields, lakes and rivers, the mountain and the sea, are excellent schoolmasters, and teach some of us more than we can ever learn from books.
data.author: John Lubbock

data.quote: I can find God in nature, in animals, in birds and the environment.
data.author: Pat Buckley

data.quote: Colors are the smiles of nature.
data.author: Leigh Hunt

data.quote: There is a certain enthusiasm in liberty, that makes human nature rise above itself, in acts of bravery and heroism.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they're still beautiful.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.
data.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

data.quote: Water is the driving force of all nature.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
data.author: Langston Hughes

data.quote: Energy, like the biblical grain of the mustard-seed, will remove mountains.
data.author: Hosea Ballou

data.quote: Autumn's the mellow time.
data.author: William Allingham

data.quote: Rain is grace; rain is the sky descending to the earth; without rain, there would be no life.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: One of the most tragic things I know about human nature is that all of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.

data.quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
data.author: Vincent Van Gogh

data.quote: On earth there is no heaven, but there are pieces of it.
data.author: Jules Renard

data.quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: I saw old Autumn in the misty morn stand shadowless like silence, listening to silence.
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: There are always flowers for those who want to see them.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: The breaking of a wave cannot explain the whole sea.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: I trust in nature for the stable laws of beauty and utility. Spring shall plant and autumn garner to the end of time.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: The sea has neither meaning nor pity.
data.author: Anton Chekhov

data.quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.
data.author: Edward Abbey

data.quote: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: If the sight of the blue skies fills you with joy, if a blade of grass springing up in the fields has power to move you, if the simple things of nature have a message that you understand, rejoice, for your soul is alive.
data.author: Eleonora Duse

data.quote: Nature holds the key to our aesthetic, intellectual, cognitive and even spiritual satisfaction.
data.author: E. O. Wilson

data.quote: It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.
data.author: Frederick Douglass

data.quote: Light in Nature creates the movement of colors.
data.author: Robert Delaunay

data.quote: The year 2100 will see eugenics universally established. In past ages, the law governing the survival of the fittest roughly weeded out the less desirable strains. data.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

data.quote: Let a hundred flowers bloom, let a hundred schools of thought contend.

data.quote: Nature never deceives us it is we who deceive ourselves.

data.quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.

data.quote: Reading about nature is fine, but if a person walks in the woods and listens carefully, he can learn more than what is in books, for they speak with the voice of God.

data.quote: Just as Darwin discovered the law of development of organic nature, so Marx discovered the law of development of human history: the simple fact, hitherto concealed by an overgrowth of ideology, that mankind must first of all eat, drink, have shelter and clothing, before it can pursue politics, science, art, religion, etc.

data.quote: Take a course in good water and air; and in the eternal youth of Nature you may renew your own. Go quietly, alone; no harm will befall you.

data.quote: Nature hath framed strange fellows in her time.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Economic medicine that was previously meted out by the cupful has recently been dispensed by the barrel. These once unthinkable dosages will almost certainly bring on unwelcome after-effects. Their precise nature is anyone's guess, though one likely consequence is an onslaught of inflation.

data.quote: The moon looks upon many night flowers the night flowers see but one moon.
data.author: Jean Ingelow

data.quote: Trying to understand the way nature works involves a most terrible test of human reasoning ability. The quantum mechanical and the relativity ideas are examples of this.
data.author: Richard P. Feynman

data.quote: Agriculture changes the landscape more than anything else we do. It alters the composition of species. We don't realize it when we sit down to eat, but that is our most profound engagement with the rest of nature.

data.quote: Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

data.quote: How inappropriate to call this planet Earth when it is quite clearly Ocean.

data.quote: Sunsets are so beautiful that they almost seem as if we were looking through the gates of Heaven.
data.author: John Lubbock

data.quote: I consider nature a vast chemical laboratory in which all kinds of composition and decompositions are formed.

data.quote: External nature is only internal nature writ large.

data.quote: As in nature, all is ebb and tide, all is wave motion, so it seems that in all branches of industry, alternating currents - electric wave motion - will have the sway.

data.quote: Painting is by nature a luminous language.

data.quote: Were I called on to define, very briefly, the term Art, I should call it 'the reproduction of what the Senses perceive in Nature through the veil of the soul.' The mere imitation, however accurate, of what is in Nature, entitles no man to the sacred name of 'Artist.'

data.quote: He who has so little knowledge of human nature as to seek happiness by changing anything but his own disposition will waste his life in fruitless efforts.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: To understand the nature of the people one must be a prince, and to understand the nature of the prince, one must be of the people.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.author: Lucy Larcom

data.quote: To the artist there is never anything ugly in nature.
data.author: Auguste Rodin

data.quote: I still get wildly enthusiastic about little things... I play with leaves. I skip down the street and run against the wind.
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Sculpture is an art of the open air. Daylight, sunlight, is necessary to it, and for me, its best setting and complement is nature.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Denial helps us to pace our feelings of grief. There is a grace in denial. It is nature's way of letting in only as much as we can handle.
data.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

data.quote: Baseball gives every American boy a chance to excel, not just to be as good as someone else but to be better than someone else. This is the nature of man and the name of the game.

data.quote: A bee is never as busy as it seems it's just that it can't buzz any slower.
data.author: Kin Hubbard

data.quote: God has cared for these trees, saved them from drought, disease, avalanches, and a thousand tempests and floods. But he cannot save them from fools.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: There is not a sprig of grass that shoots uninteresting to me.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: I think a spiritual journey is not so much a journey of discovery. It's a journey of recovery. It's a journey of uncovering your own inner nature. It's already there.
data.author: Billy Corgan

data.quote: The skull is nature's sculpture.
data.author: David Bailey

data.quote: For greed all nature is too little.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The salary of the chief executive of a large corporation is not a market award for achievement. It is frequently in the nature of a warm personal gesture by the individual to himself.
data.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

data.quote: Sunlight is painting.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: I don't like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It's just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.
data.author: Walt Disney

data.quote: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.

data.quote: To be interested in the changing seasons is a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is an example of the eternal seductiveness of life.
data.author: Jean Giraudoux

data.quote: The sea is everything. It covers seven tenths of the terrestrial globe. Its breath is pure and healthy. It is an immense desert, where man is never lonely, for he feels life stirring on all sides.

data.quote: The greatest error of a man is to think that he is weak by nature, evil by nature. Every man is divine and strong in his real nature. What are weak and evil are his habits, his desires and thoughts, but not himself.
data.author: Ramana Maharshi

data.quote: The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.
data.author: Euclid

data.quote: What is a scientist after all? It is a curious man looking through a keyhole, the keyhole of nature, trying to know what's going on.

data.quote: Sailing is the closest I can get to nature - it's adrenaline, fear, a constant challenge and learning experience, an adventure into the unknown. And of course there is nothing better than wearing the same T-shirt for days and not brushing my hair for weeks.

data.quote: Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Nature does nothing in vain.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Everything in excess is opposed to nature.
data.author: Hippocrates

data.quote: I want to do to you what spring does with the cherry trees.

data.quote: As the poet said, 'Only God can make a tree,' probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.

data.quote: In nature we never see anything isolated, but everything in connection with something else which is before it, beside it, under it and over it.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: To be admitted to Nature's hearth costs nothing. None is excluded, but excludes himself. You have only to push aside the curtain.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Nature doesn't need people - people need nature; nature would survive the extinction of the human being and go on just fine, but human culture, human beings, cannot survive without nature.

data.quote: Clouds symbolize the veils that shroud God.

data.quote: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: Anything created by human beings is already in the great book of nature.
data.author: Antoni Gaudi

data.quote: This is a day of little faith - of few convictions - a day when men seem to have no great causes and no great passions. So in frustration, in disappointment, they are inclined to say, 'You can't change human nature.' It is true that we cannot change human nature. But God can.

data.quote: Whenever I get fed up with life I love to go wandering in nature.
data.author: Andrea Arnold

data.quote: Even when I see a beautiful woman, I think, 'Aw, her life must be amazing.' Everyone does it. That's human nature to believe that beauty is everything.

data.quote: The most important thing is the indigenous people are not vindictive by nature. We are not here to oppress anybody - but to join together and build Bolivia, with justice and equality.

data.quote: Nothing is too wonderful to be true, if it be consistent with the laws of nature.
data.author: Michael Faraday

data.quote: Everyone can identify with a fragrant garden, with beauty of sunset, with the quiet of nature, with a warm and cozy cottage.

data.quote: Nature has placed mankind under the governance of two sovereign masters, pain and pleasure. It is for them alone to point out what we ought to do, as well as to determine what we shall do.

data.quote: Chaos was the law of nature Order was the dream of man.
data.author: Henry Adams

data.quote: Nature uses as little as possible of anything.
data.author: Johannes Kepler

data.quote: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: To prefer evil to good is not in human nature; and when a man is compelled to choose one of two evils, no one will choose the greater when he might have the less.

data.quote: See that the imagination of nature is far, far greater than the imagination of man.
data.author: Richard P. Feynman

data.quote: Knowledge doesn't really form part of human nature. Conflict, combat, the outcome of the combat, and, consequently, risk and chance are what gives rise to knowledge. Knowledge is not instinctive; it is counter instinctive, just as it is not natural but counter natural.

data.quote: All my life through, the new sights of Nature made me rejoice like a child.

data.quote: Fraternity among nations, however, touches the deepest desire of human nature.

data.quote: I'm concentrating on staying healthy, having peace, being happy, remembering what is important, taking in nature and animals, spending time reading, trying to understand the universe, where science and the spiritual meet.

data.quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: The earth has received the embrace of the sun and we shall see the results of that love.

data.quote: Your soul is infinitely creative. It is alive and expansive in nature. It is curious and playful, changing with the tides of time.

data.quote: Let us learn to appreciate there will be times when the trees will be bare, and look forward to the time when we may pick the fruit.

data.quote: The least movement is of importance to all nature. The entire ocean is affected by a pebble.

data.quote: Night comes to the desert all at once, as if someone turned off the light.

data.quote: Life has loveliness to sell, all beautiful and splendid things, blue waves whitened on a cliff, soaring fire that sways and sings, and children's faces looking up, holding wonder like a cup.

data.quote: The moon is at her full, and riding high, Floods the calm fields with light. The airs that hover in the summer sky Are all asleep tonight.
data.author: William C. Bryant

data.quote: Fishes live in the sea, as men do a-land; the great ones eat up the little ones.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: And the heart that is soonest awake to the flowers is always the first to be touch'd by the thorns.
data.author: Thomas Moore

data.quote: Nothing is so beautiful as spring - when weeds, in wheels, shoot long and lovely and lush; Thrush's eggs look little low heavens, and thrush through the echoing timber does so rinse and wring the ear, it strikes like lightning to hear him sing.

data.quote: Even in winter an isolated patch of snow has a special quality.

data.quote: Art is the right hand of Nature. The latter has only given us being, the former has made us men.
data.author: Friedrich Schiller

data.quote: Everything is political. I will never be a politician or even think political. Me just deal with life and nature. That is the greatest thing to me.

data.quote: By 'justice', I understand nothing more than that bond which is necessary to keep the interest of individuals united, without which men would return to their original state of barbarity. All punishments which exceed the necessity of preserving this bond are, in their nature, unjust.

data.quote: We are not weak if we make a proper use of those means which the God of Nature has placed in our power... the battle, sir, is not to the strong alone it is to the vigilant, the active, the brave.

data.quote: The very nature of science is discoveries, and the best of those discoveries are the ones you don't expect.

data.quote: All of nature begins to whisper its secrets to us through its sounds. Sounds that were previously incomprehensible to our soul now become the meaningful language of nature.

data.quote: Although our intellect always longs for clarity and certainty, our nature often finds uncertainty fascinating.

data.quote: We live on a planet that is amazing, beautiful, and full of wonder but not protected from powerful destructive forces of nature. We are capable of doing wonderful and selfless things but also self-absorbed and harmful things. This is the world we live in.

data.quote: Power is, in its nature, encroaching; and such is the human make that men who are vested with a share of it are generally inclined to take more than it was intended they should have.

data.quote: The gross heathenism of civilization has generally destroyed nature, and poetry, and all that is spiritual.

data.quote: In general, mankind, since the improvement of cookery, eats twice as much as nature requires.

data.quote: Our treasure lies in the beehive of our knowledge. We are perpetually on the way thither, being by nature winged insects and honey gatherers of the mind.

data.quote: Mother Nature may be forgiving this year, or next year, but eventually she's going to come around and whack you. You've got to be prepared.

data.quote: Polka dots can't stay alone. When we obliterate nature and our bodies with polka dots, we become part of the unity of our environments.

data.quote: If you can't sit in a cafe quietly and be ignored, how can you observe human nature and write a story?

data.quote: What I call my 'self' now is hardly a person at all. It's mainly a meeting place for various natural forces, desires, and fears, etcetera, some of which come from my ancestors, and some from my education, some perhaps from devils. data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Nature is my manifestation of God. I go to nature every day for inspiration in the day's work. I follow in building the principles which nature has used in its domain.

data.quote: Trees love to toss and sway they make such happy noises.

data.quote: I did not want to be a tree, a flower or a wave. In a dancer's body, we as audience must see ourselves, not the imitated behavior of everyday actions, not the phenomenon of nature, not exotic creatures from another planet, but something of the miracle that is a human being.

data.quote: It is the nature of babies to be in bliss.

data.quote: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another but women are by nature enemies.

data.quote: With every drop of water you drink, every breath you take, you're connected to the sea. No matter where on Earth you live. Most of the oxygen in the atmosphere is generated by the sea.

data.quote: We must trust to nothing but facts: these are presented to us by nature and cannot deceive. We ought, in every instance, to submit our reasoning to the test of experiment, and never to search for truth but by the natural road of experiment and observation.

data.quote: The temple bell stops but I still hear the sound coming out of the flowers.

data.quote: When I have a terrible need of - shall I say the word - religion. Then I go out and paint the stars.

data.quote: Everything that slows us down and forces patience, everything that sets us back into the slow circles of nature, is a help. Gardening is an instrument of grace.

data.quote: An attack upon our ability to tell stories is not just censorship - it is a crime against our nature as human beings.

data.quote: Such is the nature of men, that howsoever they may acknowledge many others to be more witty, or more eloquent, or more learned; yet they will hardly believe there be many so wise as themselves.

data.quote: Nature shows that with the growth of intelligence comes increased capacity for pain, and it is only with the highest degree of intelligence that suffering reaches its supreme point.

data.quote: Wars will remain while human nature remains. I believe in my soul in cooperation, in arbitration; but the soldier's occupation we cannot say is gone until human nature is gone.

data.quote: All art is but imitation of nature.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: I don't think homosexuality is a choice. Society forces you to think it's a choice, but in fact, it's in one's nature. The choice is whether one expresses one's nature truthfully or spends the rest of one's life lying about it.

data.quote: I am a generous man, by nature, and far more trusting than I should be. Indeed. The real world is risky territory for people with generosity of spirit. Beware.

data.quote: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I'm not a quitter. All my career, I went through a lot of physical adversity, injuries. It's in my nature to be a battler.

data.author: Sai Baba

data.quote: What is government itself but the greatest of all reflections on human nature?
data.author: James Madison

data.quote: Let the gentle bush dig its root deep and spread upward to split one boulder.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: For myself I hold no preferences among flowers, so long as they are wild, free, spontaneous. Bricks to all greenhouses! Black thumb and cutworm to the potted plant!

data.quote: How strange that nature does not knock, and yet does not intrude!

data.quote: My recollection of a hundred lovely lakes has given me blessed release from care and worry and the troubled thinking of our modern day. It has been a return to the primitive and the peaceful.

data.quote: When I see a bird that walks like a duck and swims like a duck and quacks like a duck, I call that bird a duck.
data.author: James Whitcomb Riley

data.quote: Twilight drops her curtain down, and pins it with a star.
data.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

data.quote: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Ah, summer, what power you have to make us suffer and like it.
data.author: Russell Baker

data.quote: Sweet April showers do spring May flowers.
data.author: Thomas Tusser

data.quote: I am not bound for any public place, but for ground of my own where I have planted vines and orchard trees, and in the heat of the day climbed up into the healing shadow of the woods.
data.author: Wendell Berry

data.quote: We do not see nature with our eyes, but with our understandings and our hearts.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: And this, our life, exempt from public haunt, finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks, sermons in stones, and good in everything.

data.quote: But more wonderful than the lore of old men and the lore of books is the secret lore of ocean.
data.author: H. P. Lovecraft

data.quote: Nature is so powerful, so strong. Capturing its essence is not easy - your work becomes a dance with light and the weather. It takes you to a place within yourself.
data.author: Annie Leibovitz

data.quote: Eagles commonly fly alone. They are crows, daws, and starlings that flock together.
data.author: John Webster

data.quote: The stars that have most glory have no rest.
data.author: Samuel Daniel

data.quote: Though pleas'd to see the dolphins play, I mind my compass and my way.
data.author: Matthew Green

data.quote: How inscrutable and incomprehensible are the hidden works of Nature!
data.author: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

data.quote: Look out into the universe and contemplate the glory of God. Observe the stars, millions of them, twinkling in the night sky, all with a message of unity, part of the very nature of God.
data.author: Sai Baba

data.quote: Suffering is permanent, obscure and dark, And shares the nature of infinity.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: A true nature is a gloomy monolith, sort of like that old black rotary phone that I had to sing 'Happy Birthday' to Grandpa on. But novelists, damn us, still need true natures - so we can give them to our protagonists. And so readers can vaguely predict how they'll behave when we trap them in 'situations' that they can't IM their way out of.
data.author: Walter Kirn

data.quote: Most of us who become experimental physicists do so for two reasons; we love the tools of physics because to us they have intrinsic beauty, and we dream of finding new secrets of nature as important and as exciting as those uncovered by our scientific heroes.
data.author: Luis Walter Alvarez

data.quote: Humans have certain properties and characteristics which are intrinsic to them, just as every other organism does. That's human nature.
data.author: Noam Chomsky

data.quote: Biodiversity can't be maintained by protecting a few species in a zoo, or by preserving greenbelts or national parks. To function properly, nature needs more room than that. It can maintain itself, however, without human expense, without zookeepers, park rangers, foresters or gene banks. All it needs is to be left alone.
data.author: Donella Meadows

data.quote: Nature study will show you how full of beautiful and wonderful things God has made the world for you to enjoy. Be contented with what you have got and make the best of it. Look on the bright side of things instead of the gloomy one.
data.author: Robert Baden-Powell

data.quote: In northern architecture - the cathedrals of Europe and all the little churches - the details, the carving of stone, become necessary because the light is not there to help you very much. You have to enrich surfaces. The desert reduces form to its simplest nature. There is no need for gargoyles or flying buttresses in the desert.
data.author: I. M. Pei

data.quote: Airplane travel is nature's way of making you look like your passport photo.
data.author: Al Gore

data.quote: In Japan, I was immensely impressed by the politeness, industrious nature and conscientiousness of the Japanese people.
data.author: J. Paul Getty

data.quote: A sense of the universe, a sense of the all, the nostalgia which seizes us when confronted by nature, beauty, music - these seem to be an expectation and awareness of a Great Presence.
data.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

data.quote: Only the brave know how to forgive... a coward never forgave it is not in his nature.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: Unless a man enters upon the vocation intended for him by nature, and best suited to his peculiar genius, he cannot succeed. I am glad to believe that the majority of persons do find their right vocation.
data.author: P. T. Barnum

data.quote: To explain all nature is too difficult a task for any one man or even for any one age. 'Tis much better to do a little with certainty & leave the rest for others that come after you.
data.author: Isaac Newton

data.quote: Self-preservation is the first law of nature.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: He who is of calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age, but to him who is of an opposite disposition youth and age are equally a burden.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: There are worlds of experience beyond the world of the aggressive man, beyond history, and beyond science. The moods and qualities of nature and the revelations of great art are equally difficult to define; we can grasp them only in the depths of our perceptive spirit.
data.author: Ansel Adams

data.quote: Despise not death, but welcome it, for nature wills it like all else.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: A poet ought not to pick nature's pocket. Let him borrow, and so borrow as to repay by the very act of borrowing. Examine nature accurately, but write from recollection, and trust more to the imagination than the memory.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: When a man and a woman have an overwhelming passion for each other, it seems to me, in spite of such obstacles dividing them as parents or husband, that they belong to each other in the name of Nature, and are lovers by Divine right, in spite of human convention or the laws.
data.author: Nicolas Chamfort

data.quote: A lawn is nature under totalitarian rule.
data.author: Michael Pollan

data.quote: Whatever is received is received according to the nature of the recipient.
data.author: Thomas Aquinas

data.quote: Those who made and endorsed our Constitution knew man's nature, and it is to their ideas, rather than to the temptations of utopia, that we must ask that our judges adhere.
data.author: Robert Bork

data.quote: Even in modern art, artists have used methods based on calculation, inasmuch as these elements, alongside those of a more personal and emotional nature, give balance and harmony to any work of art.
data.author: Max Bill

data.quote: Mother Nature is not sweet.
data.author: John Shelby Spong

data.quote: I am following Nature without being able to grasp her, I perhaps owe having become a painter to flowers.
data.author: Claude Monet

data.quote: The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful.
data.author: e. e. cummings

data.quote: Mere goodness can achieve little against the power of nature.
data.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

data.quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: The nature of an innovation is that it will arise at a fringe where it can afford to become prevalent enough to establish its usefulness without being overwhelmed by the inertia of the orthodox system.
data.author: Kevin Kelly

data.quote: Polaroid by its nature makes you frugal. You walk around with maybe two packs of film in your pocket. You have 20 shots, so each shot is a world.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: The nature of the human mind is such that unless it is stimulated by images of things acting upon it from without, all remembrance of them passes easily away.
data.author: Galileo Galilei

data.quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: I still love to walk in the mountains or be on the sea. I like to be in nature. Sometimes I bicycle. It's important to feel good with your body. The body is extremely important. If you feel good, you have more energy in your singing.
data.author: Cecilia Bartoli

data.quote: It is in the very nature of things human that every act that has once made its appearance and has been recorded in the history of mankind stays with mankind as a potentiality long after its actuality has become a thing of the past.
data.author: Hannah Arendt

data.quote: Time destroys the speculation of men, but it confirms nature.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: A committee is organic rather than mechanical in its nature: it is not a structure but a plant. It takes root and grows, it flowers, wilts, and dies, scattering the seed from which other committees will bloom in their turn.
data.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

data.quote: In a broader sense, the rhythms of nature, large and small - the sounds of wind and water, the sounds of birds and insects - must inevitably find their analogues in music.
data.author: George Crumb

data.quote: When all the world appears to be in a tumult, and nature itself is feeling the assault of climate change, the seasons retain their essential rhythm. Yes, fall gives us a premonition of winter, but then, winter, will be forced to relent, once again, to the new beginnings of soft greens, longer light, and the sweet air of spring.
data.author: Madeleine M. Kunin

data.quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: The air soft as that of Seville in April, and so fragrant that it was delicious to breathe it.
data.author: Christopher Columbus

data.quote: I can't go against my nature because I am what I am. I don't try to be anyone different to who I am.
data.author: Brian McDermott
data.category: I Am, I Am What I Am, Try

data.quote: All cartoon characters and fables must be exaggeration, caricatures. It is the very nature of fantasy and fable.
data.author: Walt Disney
